qas.question: How far back does evidence of inhabitation date back

answers.text: inhabitation in the region of Utrecht, dating back to the Stone Age (app. 2200 BCE)

qas.question: What did the Roman emperor Claudius decide

answers.text: Claudius decided the empire should not expand north.

qas.question: What was built along the Rhine

answers.text: To consolidate the border the limes Germanicus defense line was constructed  along the main branch of the river Rhine

qas.question: How many soldiers did the fortress hold

answers.text: These fortresses were designed to house a cohort of about 500 Roman soldiers
Near the fort settlements would grow housing artisans, traders and soldiers' wives and children

qas.question: What area area was first settled in the Stone Age?
What area was first inhabited during the Bronze age?
What was first built in 50 BCE
What was built to expand the borders durng the reign of Claudius?
Where were the soldiers and their wives housed?

context: Although there is some evidence of earlier <a0_0>inhabitation in the region of <b5_0><b6_0>Utrecht<b6_0/><b5_0/>, dating back to the Stone Age (app. 2200 BCE)<a0_0/> and settling in the Bronze Age (app. 1800–800 BCE), the founding date of the city is usually related to the construction of a <b7_0>Roman fortification<b7_0/> (castellum), probably built in around 50 CE. A series of such fortresses was built after the Roman emperor <a1_0>Claudius decided the empire should not expand north.<a1_0/> <a2_0>To consolidate the border <b8_0>the limes Germanicus defense line<b8_0/> was constructed  along the main branch of the river Rhine<a2_0/>, which at that time flowed through a more northern bed compared to today (what is now the Kromme Rijn). <a3_0>These <b9_0>fortresses<b9_0/> were designed to house a cohort of about 500 Roman soldiers<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Near the fort settlements would grow housing artisans, traders and soldiers' wives and children<a4_0/>.
